problem: Estimate the kinetic energy of the Earth with respect to the Sun as the sum of two terms, (a) that due to its daily rotation about its axis, and (b) that due to its yearly revolution about the Sun. [Assume the Earth is a uniform sphere with mass=6.0×10²⁴ kg, radius=6.4×10⁶ m, and is 1.5×10⁸ km from the Sun.]

correctFormulas.name: Moment of inertia of a uniform sphere

steps.explanation: Part (a): We will use rotational kinetic energy K = ½ I ω² with the moment of inertia for a uniform sphere I = (2/5) M R²
steps.notations: K₍daily₎ = ½ I₍sphere₎ ω₍day₎² where I₍sphere₎ = (2/5) M₍E₎ R₍E₎²

steps.explanation: Define the given values for daily rotation
Calculate the angular velocity for daily rotation
Substitute the moment of inertia formula into the kinetic energy equation
steps.notations: K₍daily₎ = ½ [(2/5) M₍E₎ R₍E₎²] ω₍day₎² = (1/5) M₍E₎ R₍E₎² ω₍day₎²

steps.explanation: Substitute numerical values for daily rotation
Calculate the daily rotational kinetic energy
Part (b): We will use translational kinetic energy K = ½ m v² with v = ω R for the orbital motion
steps.notations: K₍yearly₎ = ½ M₍E₎ v₍orb₎² where v₍orb₎ = ω₍year₎ R₍orb₎

steps.explanation: Define the given values for yearly revolution
Calculate the angular velocity for yearly revolution
Substitute v = ω R into the kinetic energy formula
Substitute numerical values for yearly revolution
Calculate the yearly orbital kinetic energy
Sum the two contributions to get total kinetic energy
steps.notations: K₍total₎ = K₍daily₎ + K₍yearly₎ ≈ 2.6 × 10²⁹ J + 2.7 × 10³³ J ≈ 2.7 × 10³³ J (orbital term dominates)

solution:
Part (a) - Daily rotation:
K₍daily₎ = ½Iω²
I = (2/5)M₍E₎R₍E₎² = (2/5)(6.0 × 10²⁴ kg)(6.4 × 10⁶ m)² = 9.83 × 10³⁷ kg·m²
ω₍day₎ = 2π/T₍day₎ = 2π/86400 s = 7.27 × 10⁻⁵ rad/s
K₍daily₎ = ½(9.83 × 10³⁷ kg·m²)(7.27 × 10⁻⁵ rad/s)²
K₍daily₎ = 2.6 × 10²⁹ J

Part (b) - Yearly revolution:
K₍yearly₎ = ½M₍E₎v²
v = ωR = ω₍year₎R₍orb₎
ω₍year₎ = 2π/T₍year₎ = 2π/(3.156 × 10⁷ s) = 1.99 × 10⁻⁷ rad/s
v₍orb₎ = (1.99 × 10⁻⁷ rad/s)(1.5 × 10¹¹ m) = 2.99 × 10⁴ m/s
K₍yearly₎ = ½(6.0 × 10²⁴ kg)(2.99 × 10⁴ m/s)²
K₍yearly₎ = 2.7 × 10³³ J

Total:
K₍total₎ = K₍daily₎ + K₍yearly₎ = 2.6 × 10²⁹ J + 2.7 × 10³³ J ≈ 2.7 × 10³³ J
